intro: Glandularia gooddingii, commonly known as Goodding's bluebonnet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the tribe Melampodinae within the genus Glandularia, which is part of the family Polemoniaceae. The plant is characterized by its glandular-hairy stems and leaves, which are typical features of the genus. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, with five petals and a distinctive spur at the base of the throat. Glandularia gooddingii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
